tools.name: libPeR_base
tools.one_line_profile: Library for vision-based robot state estimation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library developed by the Robotic Perception group (MIS lab) for vision-based state estimation of robots and scenes. It provides core functionalities for perception tasks in robotics.

tools.name: data_tamer
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for high-performance time series logging in robotics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed for 'fearless' time series logging, optimized for robotics applications. It allows for efficient data recording with minimal overhead, facilitating post-hoc analysis and debugging of robot behavior.

tools.name: plotjuggler-CAN-dbs
tools.one_line_profile: PlotJuggler plugin for visualizing CAN bus data
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PlotJuggler that enables the visualization of CAN bus data using .dbs files. It allows engineers to decode and plot CAN messages, which is essential for debugging and monitoring automotive and robotic systems.

tools.name: plotjuggler-lsl
tools.one_line_profile: PlotJuggler plugin for Lab Streaming Layer (LSL) data
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PlotJuggler that supports the Lab Streaming Layer (LSL) protocol. LSL is widely used in scientific experiments (e.g., EEG, BCI) for unified time-series data collection, and this plugin enables real-time visualization of such streams.

tools.name: plotjuggler-ros-plugins
tools.one_line_profile: PlotJuggler plugins for ROS and ROS2 data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of plugins for PlotJuggler that enable seamless integration with ROS and ROS2. These plugins allow users to visualize ROS topics and messages in real-time or from bag files, making it a standard tool for robotics debugging.

tools.name: NeuroMHE
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Moving Horizon Estimation for adaptive optimal estimation
tools.detailed_description: An auto-tuning and adaptive optimal estimator that fuses a neural network with Moving Horizon Estimation (MHE). It is designed for fast online adaptation to state-dependent noise in robotic systems, improving state estimation accuracy.

tools.name: VAE-for-Anomaly-Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of Variational Auto-Encoder (VAE) implementations for anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing implementations of various VAE architectures (MLP_VAE, LSTM_VAE, IndRNN_VAE) specifically tailored for anomaly detection tasks in multivariate time-series data.

tools.name: alibi-detect
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for outlier, adversarial, and drift detection
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library focused on outlier, adversarial, and concept drift detection. It provides a wide range of algorithms for tabular, image, and time series data, suitable for monitoring scientific data pipelines and models.

tools.name: TSB-AD
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for time-series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark for evaluating anomaly detection algorithms on time-series data. It includes datasets and evaluation scripts to assess the reliability of detection methods.

tools.name: TSB-UAD
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end benchmark suite for univariate time-series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite specifically designed for univariate time-series anomaly detection, providing datasets, metrics, and baseline implementations for comparative analysis.

tools.name: DeepLog
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of DeepLog for system log anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the DeepLog model for detecting anomalies in system logs using deep learning (LSTM). Useful for diagnosing faults in complex automated systems.

tools.name: TimeEval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation tool for anomaly detection algorithms on time series
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to evaluate and compare various anomaly detection algorithms on time series data, facilitating the selection of appropriate methods for scientific monitoring.

tools.name: TimeEval-algorithms
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of time series anomaly detection algorithms for TimeEval
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing Docker-based implementations of various time series anomaly detection algorithms, designed to be used with the TimeEval evaluation tool.

tools.name: Variational-Lstm-Autoencoder
tools.one_line_profile: LSTM Variational Autoencoder for time series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a Variational LSTM Autoencoder for detecting anomalies and extracting features from time series data, applicable to sensor monitoring.

tools.name: drift
tools.one_line_profile: Symmetry-preserving state estimation library for robotic platforms
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for state estimation (Dead Reckoning In Field Time) in robotics, preserving symmetries for accurate monitoring of robot states.

tools.name: LogAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble framework for log-based anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A framework that combines multiple log-based anomaly detection methods into an ensemble to improve fault diagnosis accuracy.

tools.name: PyPOTS
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for partially-observed time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for analyzing partially-observed time series, including tasks like imputation, classification, forecasting, and anomaly detection, suitable for industrial and scientific data.

tools.name: leg-odometry
tools.one_line_profile: Proprioceptive state estimation for legged robots
tools.detailed_description: A tool for estimating the state (odometry) of legged robots using IMU and joint encoders, essential for robot monitoring and control.

tools.name: condition-monitoring-system-for-gas-turbine
tools.one_line_profile: Condition monitoring and fault diagnosis system for gas turbines
tools.detailed_description: A system designed for monitoring the condition of gas turbines, including anomaly detection and fault diagnosis functionalities.

tools.name: Unsupervised-Deep-Learning-Framework-for-Anomaly-Detection-in-Time-Series
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised deep learning framework for time series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A framework providing various unsupervised deep learning models (MLP, Conv1D, VAE, Wavenet) for detecting anomalies in time series data.

tools.name: anomaly-detection-log-datasets
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis scripts for log anomaly detection datasets
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts to analyze and process log datasets used for anomaly detection research, facilitating data preparation and understanding.

tools.name: logdata-anomaly-miner
tools.one_line_profile: Log data parsing and anomaly detection pipeline tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to parse log data and define analysis pipelines for anomaly detection, optimized for running with limited resources on production servers.

tools.name: msda
tools.one_line_profile: Library for multi-sensor data analysis and anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A library for multi-dimensional, multi-sensor, and multivariate time series data analysis, including unsupervised feature selection and deep anomaly detection.

tools.name: Prometheus
tools.one_line_profile: Open source autonomous drone software platform
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source software platform for autonomous drones, including modules for state estimation, mapping, and planning, enabling advanced robotic monitoring and control.

tools.name: airflow-provider-anomaly-detection
tools.one_line_profile: Airflow provider for anomaly detection tasks
tools.detailed_description: An Apache Airflow provider that integrates anomaly detection capabilities directly into Airflow workflows, facilitating automated monitoring pipelines.

tools.name: ADTK
tools.one_line_profile: A Python toolkit for rule-based and unsupervised anomaly detection in time series
tools.detailed_description: ADTK (Anomaly Detection Toolkit) is a Python package for unsupervised / rule-based time series anomaly detection. It offers a set of common detectors, transformers, and aggregators to build anomaly detection models for scientific and industrial sensor data.

tools.name: Curve
tools.one_line_profile: An integrated experimental platform for time series data anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: Curve is an open-source platform designed to support the full lifecycle of time series anomaly detection, including data labeling, model training, and evaluation. It is suitable for handling sensor data in laboratory and industrial settings.

tools.name: pyodeint
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper around the boost odeint C++ library for numerical integration
tools.detailed_description: pyodeint provides a Python interface to the C++ boost::numeric::odeint library, enabling efficient numerical integration of ordinary differential equations (ODEs) for scientific modeling and simulation.

tools.name: pyodesys
tools.one_line_profile: A Python library for straightforward numerical integration of systems of ODEs
tools.detailed_description: pyodesys offers a unified interface for integrating systems of ordinary differential equations, supporting symbolic representation and multiple backend solvers (including GSL, CVODE, and odeint).

tools.name: QRCodeStateEstimation
tools.one_line_profile: A library for robot pose estimation using QR codes
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed to determine the 3D pose (state estimation) of robots or UAVs by visually tracking QR codes, serving as a localization tool in robotics research.

tools.name: cockpit-ros2-diagnostics
tools.one_line_profile: A Cockpit plugin to display ROS 2 diagnostic information for robot monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the Cockpit web interface that visualizes ROS 2 diagnostic messages, enabling real-time health monitoring and fault diagnosis of robotic systems.

tools.name: cognitoware-robotics
tools.one_line_profile: A C++ library for probabilistic state estimation and Bayes filters in robotics
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing probabilistic state estimation algorithms for robotics, including Kalman filters, Markov chains, and distribution handling for sensor models.

tools.name: robot_localization
tools.one_line_profile: A ROS package for nonlinear state estimation and sensor fusion
tools.detailed_description: A standard ROS package that provides nonlinear state estimation through Extended Kalman Filters (EKF) and Unscented Kalman Filters (UKF) to fuse sensor data for robust robot localization.

tools.name: PyODDS
tools.one_line_profile: An end-to-end system for outlier detection with database support
tools.detailed_description: PyODDS is an end-to-end Python system for outlier detection that supports database backend integration, enabling efficient anomaly detection on large-scale scientific or industrial datasets.

tools.name: CATCH
tools.one_line_profile: Channel-Aware Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection Model
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the CATCH model for multivariate time series anomaly detection, utilizing frequency patching and channel-aware attention mechanisms to capture temporal and spectral dependencies.

tools.name: TAB
tools.one_line_profile: Unified Benchmarking Framework for Time Series Anomaly Detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmarking library for evaluating time series anomaly detection algorithms, providing unified datasets, metrics, and baseline implementations to standardize research and application.

tools.name: PlotJuggler
tools.one_line_profile: Time Series Visualization Tool for Robotics and Logs
tools.detailed_description: A fast and intuitive desktop application for visualizing and analyzing time series data. It supports various data formats including ROS bags, CSV, and ULog, making it a standard tool for robotics debugging and sensor data monitoring.

tools.name: pyoats
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Time Series Outlier Detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for quick and easy detection of outliers in time series data, providing implementations of various statistical and machine learning-based detection methods suitable for sensor data analysis.

tools.name: pyodk
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python Client for Open Data Kit (ODK)
tools.detailed_description: The official Python library for interacting with ODK Central, enabling programmatic access to scientific field data collection projects, form management, and data retrieval for analysis.

tools.name: MiniShift-Simple3D
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time 3D anomaly detection framework for high-resolution industrial defects
tools.detailed_description: A scalable dataset and real-time framework implementation for detecting subtle industrial defects using high-resolution 3D anomaly detection techniques. It serves as a solver for 3D surface inspection tasks.

tools.name: muse
tools.one_line_profile: State estimation package for quadruped robots fusing proprioceptive and exteroceptive data
tools.detailed_description: A robotics library designed for quadruped state estimation, integrating various sensor data sources to provide accurate robot localization and status monitoring.

tools.name: go2_odometry
tools.one_line_profile: State estimation solver for Unitree Go2 robots
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight state estimation tool specifically designed for the Unitree Go2 robot platform, enabling odometry tracking for robotics research and monitoring.

tools.name: Industrial-Anomaly-Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Virtualization-based platform for running multiple industrial anomaly detection workloads
tools.detailed_description: A reference implementation and platform for executing independent anomaly detection workloads (such as object flaws and motor defects) on a single system using KVM virtualization, suitable for industrial monitoring setups.

tools.name: DEnKF
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Ensemble Kalman Filter for robot state estimation
tools.detailed_description: A data-driven approach to enhance state estimation in robotics using Differentiable Ensemble Kalman Filters, providing a solver for filtering and estimation tasks.

tools.name: CUDA-Accelerated-Visual-Inertial-Odometry-Fusion
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Unscented Kalman Filter for visual-inertial odometry fusion
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance C++ library utilizing CUDA for real-time fusion of visual odometry and IMU data via Unscented Kalman Filter (UKF), designed for robotics state estimation.

tools.name: RAD
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for real-life anomaly detection with robotic observations
tools.detailed_description: A dataset and benchmark suite designed for evaluating anomaly detection algorithms in robotic scenarios, providing real-world observational data.

tools.name: labml
tools.one_line_profile: Mobile monitoring library for deep learning model training and hardware usage
tools.detailed_description: A library for monitoring deep learning experiments, tracking training metrics and hardware resource usage (GPU/CPU) in real-time, facilitating the scientific process of model development.

tools.name: VAE-LSTM-for-anomaly-detection
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised VAE-LSTM model for time series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a VAE-LSTM hybrid model for unsupervised anomaly detection in time series data, serving as a solver for signal analysis tasks.

tools.name: fuse
tools.one_line_profile: General architecture for live sensor fusion on robots
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive stack for performing real-time sensor fusion on robots, supporting applications like state estimation, localization, mapping, and calibration.

tools.name: monitoring
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for analyzing and monitoring ROS systems
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool designed to monitor and analyze Robot Operating System (ROS) environments, aiding in the diagnosis and observation of robotic system behaviors.

tools.name: anomalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic anomaly detection library for time series data
tools.detailed_description: A Go library implementing probabilistic models for detecting anomalies in time series data, applicable to sensor data analysis and monitoring tasks.

tools.name: ADBenchmarks-anomaly-detection-datasets
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive repository of real-world anomaly detection datasets
tools.detailed_description: A collection of diverse anomaly detection datasets covering tabular, time series, graph, image, and video data, serving as a benchmark resource for evaluating AD algorithms.

tools.name: mtad-gat
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Time-series Anomaly Detection via Graph Attention Network
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the MTAD-GAT model for detecting anomalies in multivariate time-series data using graph attention networks, suitable for complex sensor data analysis.

tools.name: TagAnomaly
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly detection analysis and labeling tool for time series data
tools.detailed_description: A tool specifically designed for the analysis and labeling of anomalies in multiple time series datasets. It allows users to visualize time series and tag regions of interest, aiding in the creation of labeled datasets for supervised anomaly detection models.

tools.name: Anomalib
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for anomaly detection in images and time series
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning library that collects state-of-the-art anomaly detection algorithms for benchmarking, developing, and deploying anomaly detection models. It supports experiment management and hyper-parameter optimization, specifically targeting visual inspection and defect detection tasks.

tools.name: legged_control
tools.one_line_profile: NMPC and WBC based control and simulation framework for legged robots
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for legged robot control, state estimation, and Sim2Real simulation, utilizing Non-linear Model Predictive Control (NMPC) and Whole-Body Control (WBC) based on OCS2 and ROS controls.

tools.name: ros_jetson_stats
tools.one_line_profile: ROS wrapper for monitoring NVIDIA Jetson hardware diagnostics
tools.detailed_description: A ROS package that integrates NVIDIA Jetson hardware status (CPU/GPU usage, temperature, fan speed) into the robot's diagnostic system, enabling real-time hardware monitoring and fault detection.

tools.name: ros-graph-monitor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for monitoring ROS application structure and node health
tools.detailed_description: A diagnostic tool designed to monitor the structure of ROS (Robot Operating System) graphs, verifying node connectivity and topic statistics to ensure application integrity.

tools.name: ros_diagnostics
tools.one_line_profile: Standard ROS stack for collecting and analyzing robot diagnostics
tools.detailed_description: The standard diagnostics stack for ROS, providing tools and libraries (diagnostic_aggregator, diagnostic_analysis) to collect, aggregate, and visualize diagnostic data from robot hardware and software.

tools.name: topnode
tools.one_line_profile: Resource monitoring component for ROS 2 nodes
tools.detailed_description: A ROS 2 component that monitors system resource usage (CPU, memory) of other nodes, facilitating performance analysis and anomaly detection in robotic systems.

tools.name: Orion
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised time series anomaly detection library
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library built for unsupervised time series anomaly detection, providing verified pipelines for detecting anomalies in satellite telemetry and other scientific sensor data.

tools.name: Anomaly-Transformer
tools.one_line_profile: Time series anomaly detection model using association discrepancy
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model implementation for unsupervised anomaly detection in time series data, utilizing an Anomaly-Transformer architecture to capture association discrepancies.

tools.name: Darts
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for easy manipulation and forecasting of time series
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for user-friendly forecasting and anomaly detection on time series, supporting a variety of models from ARIMA to deep neural networks.

tools.name: Anomaly Detection in Industry
tools.one_line_profile: UI pipeline for training and inference of industrial anomaly detection models
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface and pipeline for training and deploying anomaly detection models (based on Anomalib) specifically for industrial manufacturing inspection tasks.

tools.name: SKAB
tools.one_line_profile: Skoltech Anomaly Benchmark for time-series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset designed for evaluating algorithms for anomaly detection in time-series data, specifically focused on embedded systems and testbeds.

tools.name: DeepOD
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based outlier and anomaly detection library
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for deep learning-based anomaly detection, providing implementations of various state-of-the-art algorithms for tabular and time-series data.

tools.name: PyOD
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects
tools.detailed_description: A scalable Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data, featuring over 40 detection algorithms ranging from classical techniques to deep learning models.

tools.name: GTA
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Transformer for Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Graph Transformer network designed to learn graph structures for detecting anomalies in multivariate time series data, particularly for IoT applications.

tools.name: CARLA
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised contrastive learning for time series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A self-supervised contrastive learning model (CARLA) designed to learn robust representations of time series data for enhanced anomaly detection capabilities.

tools.name: TS-Anomaly-Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive benchmark for time-series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A curated collection of datasets and evaluation scripts serving as a comprehensive benchmark for assessing time-series anomaly detection algorithms.

tools.name: LogSAD
tools.one_line_profile: Training-free anomaly detection with vision and language foundation models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a training-free anomaly detection approach leveraging vision and language foundation models, targeting log analysis tasks (CVPR 2025).

tools.name: InterFusion
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate time series anomaly detection using hierarchical embedding
tools.detailed_description: A model for multivariate time series anomaly detection and interpretation that uses hierarchical inter-metric and temporal embeddings to capture complex dependencies.

tools.name: Co-LRIO
tools.one_line_profile: LiDAR-Ranging-Inertial Centralized State Estimation for Robotic Swarms
tools.detailed_description: A ROS2 package implementing centralized state estimation for robotic swarms by fusing LiDAR, ranging, and inertial data, useful for monitoring robot states.

tools.name: Industrial Defect Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning system for industrial product defect detection
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based system designed for automated visual inspection and defect detection in industrial products, aiming to replace manual quality control.

tools.name: react-workflow-viz
tools.one_line_profile: React component for visualizing CWL-like scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: A React component designed to visualize Common Workflow Language (CWL) and similar scientific workflow data structures, developed by the 4D Nucleome Data Coordination and Integration Center.

tools.name: Blue Brain Nexus
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge graph and data management platform for data-driven science
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive knowledge graph and data management platform designed to support data-driven science, providing features for data provenance, access control, and integration, developed by the Blue Brain Project.

tools.name: matlab-dataone
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab Toolbox for interacting with DataONE repositories and managing provenance
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab Toolbox that provides functions to interact with DataONE service API repositories, including client-side functions for managing the provenance (history) of derived scientific data products.

tools.name: Jovian Archive
tools.one_line_profile: Metagenomics/viromics pipeline with automated audit trails
tools.detailed_description: A metagenomics and viromics analysis pipeline designed for automation and user-friendliness, featuring a clear audit trail to empower biologists to perform analyses without bioinformatics expertise.

tools.name: niprov
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance tracking tool for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to capture, log, and manage provenance information for neuroimaging data processing, supporting standard formats like DICOM and NIfTI to ensure reproducibility in neuroscience research.

tools.name: aiida-jutools
tools.one_line_profile: Helper tools for AiiDA workflows in materials science
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utility functions and classes to simplify the creation and management of AiiDA workflows for computational materials science, developed by the Jülich Research Centre.

tools.name: pylabcontrol
tools.one_line_profile: Laboratory equipment control library for scientific experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for controlling laboratory instruments and automating scientific experiments, providing interfaces for device communication and data acquisition.

tools.name: Kosh
tools.one_line_profile: Data management and query API for scientific codes
tools.detailed_description: A framework developed by LLNL that enables scientific simulation codes to store, query, and share data via an easy-to-use Python API, leveraging the Sina database backend for HPC environments.

tools.name: Crate-O
tools.one_line_profile: Editor for Research Object Crates (RO-Crate)
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for creating and editing Research Object Crates (RO-Crate), facilitating the packaging of research data with rich metadata and provenance information for FAIR data compliance.

tools.name: SimpleWorkflows.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight workflow engine for scientific computing in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A simple workflow management system implemented in Julia, designed to orchestrate scientific computing tasks and data processing pipelines, particularly for minerals and materials science applications.

tools.name: Flowcept
tools.one_line_profile: Runtime provenance capture for AI and scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by ORNL for capturing, enriching, and querying provenance data from AI and scientific workflows across edge, cloud, and HPC environments, enabling observability and reproducibility.

tools.name: CPL (Core Provenance Library)
tools.one_line_profile: Library for collecting and querying data provenance in scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: CPL (Core Provenance Library) is a C++ library designed to collect, store, and query provenance data (lineage) of computational results. It is widely used in scientific computing to ensure reproducibility and auditability of data processing steps.

tools.name: RO-Crate
tools.one_line_profile: Community standard and tooling for packaging research objects with metadata
tools.detailed_description: RO-Crate is a lightweight method for packaging research data, code, and metadata to make them FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable). This repository contains the specification and examples for creating Research Object Crates.

tools.name: ro-crate-preview-action
tools.one_line_profile: GitHub Action to generate HTML previews for RO-Crate research packages
tools.detailed_description: A CI/CD tool that automatically builds human-readable HTML previews from RO-Crate metadata, facilitating the visualization and verification of research data packages in scientific workflows.

tools.name: ro-crate-py
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for creating and consuming RO-Crate research packages
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an API to read, write, and manipulate RO-Crate metadata and data packages, enabling programmatic management of research objects in scientific pipelines.

tools.name: ro-crate-validator-py
tools.one_line_profile: Validator for Research Object Crate (RO-Crate) metadata
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool to validate RO-Crate packages against the specification, ensuring that research data packages contain correct and complete metadata for reproducibility and archiving.

tools.name: runcrate
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to execute CWL workflows packaged in RO-Crates
tools.detailed_description: runcrate allows for the execution of computational workflows (specifically Common Workflow Language) that are packaged within an RO-Crate, bridging the gap between data packaging and workflow execution.

tools.name: workflow-run-crate
tools.one_line_profile: Profile for capturing workflow execution provenance in RO-Crate
tools.detailed_description: Defines profiles and utilities for capturing the provenance of workflow runs (inputs, outputs, execution environment) within the RO-Crate format, essential for audit trails in scientific computing.

tools.name: Peritus
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for multimedia forensic analysis and chain of custody management
tools.detailed_description: Peritus is a platform designed for multimedia analysts to normalize procedures, improve documentation quality, and reinforce auditability and reproducibility in forensic science. It strengthens the chain of custody for digital evidence.

tools.name: DescribeML
tools.one_line_profile: VS Code extension for describing machine learning datasets and provenance
tools.detailed_description: DescribeML is a tool to describe machine-learning datasets in a structured format, focusing on composition, provenance, and social concerns. It aids in the documentation and auditability of data used in scientific AI models.

tools.name: Phenomanager
tools.one_line_profile: Management system for biological phenotype data
tools.detailed_description: Phenomanager is a tool developed by UFF e-Science group for managing phenotype data. It likely supports the collection, organization, and analysis of biological trait data in research contexts.

tools.name: reproserver
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for reproducing ReproZip experiments in the cloud
tools.detailed_description: ReproServer is a web-based platform that allows users to upload and reproduce experiments packaged with ReproZip. It facilitates the verification and exploration of scientific results in a cloud environment.

tools.name: ReproZip
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for packing and reproducing scientific experiments
tools.detailed_description: ReproZip is a tool that simplifies the process of creating reproducible experiments from command-line executions. It tracks operating system calls to capture all dependencies and data files, creating a self-contained package that can be run on other machines.

tools.name: VersionClimber
tools.one_line_profile: System for package evolution and dependency management in Data Science
tools.detailed_description: Version Climber is a system designed to handle package evolution and dependency versioning specifically for Data Science workflows, aiding in the reproducibility and stability of computational environments.

tools.name: VisTrails
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific workflow and provenance management system
tools.detailed_description: VisTrails is an open-source scientific workflow management system that provides comprehensive provenance infrastructure. It maintains detailed history of steps followed and data derived in exploratory tasks, allowing for reproducibility and versioning of workflows.

tools.name: AiiDA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Interactive Infrastructure and Database for Computational Science
tools.detailed_description: AiiDA is an open-source workflow manager designed for computational science and materials science. It provides a robust infrastructure to automate simulations, manage high-throughput calculations, and strictly track the provenance of data and computations to ensure reproducibility.

tools.name: AiiDA-CP2K
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the CP2K quantum chemistry software
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with CP2K, a software package for atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems. It enables automated execution of CP2K calculations with full data provenance tracking.

tools.name: AiiDA WorkGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Visual workflow designer and manager for AiiDA
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface and workflow management tool for AiiDA that allows researchers to design flexible workflows interactively. It supports checkpoints, remote execution, and provenance tracking for computational science tasks.

tools.name: Robot Security Framework (RSF)
tools.one_line_profile: Standardized methodology for robot security assessments
tools.detailed_description: The Robot Security Framework (RSF) provides a standardized methodology to perform security assessments in robotics. It helps researchers and engineers identify vulnerabilities and ensure the security of robotic systems used in laboratories and industry.

tools.name: Robot Vulnerability Database (RVD)
tools.one_line_profile: Archive of robot vulnerabilities and bugs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive database and archive of known vulnerabilities and bugs in robots and robotic software. It serves as a critical resource for security auditing and risk assessment in robotic infrastructure.

tools.name: RVSS
tools.one_line_profile: Robot Vulnerability Scoring System implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python reference implementation of the Robot Vulnerability Scoring System (RVSS), designed to score and assess the severity of security vulnerabilities specifically in the context of robotic systems.

tools.name: aztarna
tools.one_line_profile: Footprinting and reconnaissance tool for robots
tools.detailed_description: A security tool designed for footprinting robots and robotic components on a network. It helps in identifying connected robotic devices and assessing their security posture in automated lab or industrial environments.

tools.name: Software Ontology (SWO)
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology for describing software tools and provenance
tools.detailed_description: The Software Ontology (SWO) is a resource for describing software tools, their types, tasks, versions, licenses, and provenance. It supports semantic annotation and data lineage tracking in scientific workflows.

tools.name: DataLad-OSF
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for Open Science Framework integration
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that enables seamless interfacing with the Open Science Framework (OSF), allowing researchers to use OSF as a special remote for dataset storage, retrieval, and provenance tracking within the DataLad ecosystem.

tools.name: DataLad-UKBiobank
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for accessing UK Biobank datasets
tools.detailed_description: A specialized DataLad extension providing tools and resources to manage, access, and track provenance of UK Biobank datasets, streamlining the workflow for researchers handling this large-scale biomedical database.

tools.name: MLProvLab
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance management for data science notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to capture, manage, and visualize provenance information within data science notebooks (like Jupyter), enabling researchers to track the history and reproducibility of machine learning experiments.

tools.name: Ground
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source data context service for managing data lineage and provenance
tools.detailed_description: A vendor-neutral data context service developed by RISELab that manages the lineage and provenance of data, enabling reproducibility and auditability in scientific and analytical workflows.

tools.name: prov-io
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance management framework for scientific data I/O
tools.detailed_description: A provenance management framework specifically designed for scientific data I/O libraries, enabling the tracking and management of data generation history in high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: ro-crate-rs
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for Research Object Crates (RO-Crate)
tools.detailed_description: A Rust implementation for defining and manipulating RO-Crates, a community standard for packaging research data with their metadata and provenance to ensure reproducibility.

tools.name: Loops
tools.one_line_profile: JupyterLab extension for provenance tracking in exploratory data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension developed by JKU Visual Data Science Lab that supports and visualizes the provenance of iterative and exploratory data analysis steps in computational notebooks.

tools.name: NovaCrate
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based editor for creating and validating Research Object Crates (RO-Crate)
tools.detailed_description: NovaCrate is a web-based interactive editor designed for creating, editing, visualizing, and validating Research Object Crates (RO-Crate). It facilitates the management of research data packages with embedded metadata and provenance, adhering to the RO-Crate community standard.

tools.name: Kurator-Akka
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance-enabled workflow platform for biodiversity data curation
tools.detailed_description: Kurator-Akka is a workflow platform and toolkit designed to curate biodiversity data. It leverages the Akka framework to provide a provenance-enabled environment for executing scientific workflows, ensuring data lineage and reproducibility in biodiversity research.

tools.name: aiida-raspa
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the RASPA molecular simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA provenance and workflow engine that interfaces with RASPA, a software package for simulating adsorption and diffusion of molecules in flexible nanoporous materials. It enables reproducible and provenance-tracked computational chemistry workflows.

tools.name: ProvToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for creating and manipulating W3C PROV data model representations
tools.detailed_description: A Java toolkit (with bindings for other languages) for creating, converting, and manipulating representations of the W3C PROV data model. It is a fundamental tool for implementing provenance-enabled scientific applications and ensuring data lineage interoperability.

tools.name: DataTracker
tools.one_line_profile: Pin tool for collecting high-fidelity data provenance from unmodified programs
tools.detailed_description: DataTracker is a dynamic binary instrumentation tool based on Pin that collects high-fidelity data provenance from unmodified binaries. It is used in systems research to trace data lineage and audit information flow within applications.

tools.name: datalad-getexec
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for code execution during dataset retrieval
tools.detailed_description: An extension for DataLad, a distributed data management system, that allows for code execution during 'get' commands. This facilitates reproducible workflows where data retrieval involves dynamic generation or processing steps, enhancing provenance and automation in scientific data management.

tools.name: Wrapyfi
tools.one_line_profile: Middleware wrapper for integrating robotics messaging with deep learning frameworks
tools.detailed_description: Wrapyfi is a middleware wrapper that facilitates the integration of robotics messaging systems (like ROS, ROS2, ZeroMQ) with deep learning frameworks (such as PyTorch, TensorFlow). It enables seamless transmission of multimodal data (sensors, audio, video) across different machines and processes, supporting scientific experiments in robotics and embodied AI.

tools.name: PrimeHub
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source MLOps platform for scientific machine learning workflows
tools.detailed_description: PrimeHub is a Kubernetes-based MLOps platform designed to help data science teams manage the lifecycle of machine learning models. It provides a collaborative environment for dataset management, model training, and deployment, facilitating reproducible AI research and scientific computation.

tools.name: Giovanni
tools.one_line_profile: Web environment for visualization and analysis of NASA Earth science data
tools.detailed_description: Giovanni is an online environment developed by NASA for the display and analysis of geophysical parameters. It allows researchers to access, visualize, and analyze vast amounts of Earth science data without downloading it, while providing provenance information for data lineage tracking.

tools.name: CanvasXpress
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript visualization library for genomics and scientific data
tools.detailed_description: CanvasXpress is a standalone JavaScript library for visualizing complex scientific data, particularly in genomics and proteomics (e.g., heatmaps, boxplots, scatter plots). It includes full audit trail capabilities to track data modifications and visualization parameters, supporting reproducibility in scientific analysis.

tools.name: nf-prov
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow plugin for generating provenance reports
tools.detailed_description: nf-prov is a plugin for the Nextflow workflow manager that captures and renders provenance information for pipeline runs. It supports standard scientific provenance formats such as BioCompute Objects (BCO) and Workflow Run RO-Crate, ensuring reproducibility and transparency in bioinformatics pipelines.

tools.name: ARCtrl
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing Annotated Research Contexts (ARCs) in plant science
tools.detailed_description: ARCtrl is a polyglot library designed to create, manipulate, and validate Annotated Research Contexts (ARCs), a data standard used in the NFDI4Plants infrastructure. It facilitates the management of metadata and experimental data in plant science, ensuring data interoperability and FAIR principles.

tools.name: ya2ro
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert YAML descriptions into Research Object Crates
tools.detailed_description: ya2ro is a Python package that automates the creation of Research Objects (RO-Crate) from simple YAML configuration files. It aggregates datasets, source code, and author information into a machine-readable format (RO-Crate) and generates an HTML representation, supporting scientific data packaging and provenance.

tools.name: HERITRACE
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic editor for GLAM data with provenance tracking
tools.detailed_description: HERITRACE is a semantic editor designed for professionals in Galleries, Libraries, Archives, and Museums (GLAM). It allows domain experts to enrich and edit cultural heritage data with semantic capabilities, featuring robust provenance tracking and change history to ensure data integrity in digital humanities research.

tools.name: EIP-OpenMRS-SENAITE
tools.one_line_profile: Integration routes for OpenMRS and SENAITE LIMS
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides Apache Camel routes to integrate OpenMRS (Medical Record System) with SENAITE (Laboratory Information Management System). It automates the exchange of patient and test data between clinical and laboratory systems, facilitating lab automation and health informatics research.

tools.name: PLUS
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance modeling and analysis framework
tools.detailed_description: PLUS (Provenance: Linking and Understanding Sources) is a framework designed to capture, model, and analyze the provenance of data in scientific and computing workflows. It helps researchers understand the lineage of their data, supporting reproducibility and trust in scientific results.

tools.name: Vera
tools.one_line_profile: ERAV data model implementation for citizen science
tools.detailed_description: Vera is a reference implementation of the ERAV (Entity-Record-Attribute-Value) data model, built on the wq framework. It is designed for managing complex time-series and observational data in citizen science and field research projects, facilitating flexible data collection and management.

tools.name: PROV-A
tools.one_line_profile: Web tool for creating provenance as Linked Open Data
tools.detailed_description: PROV-A (The Provenance App) is a web-based tool that streamlines the creation and publication of provenance information adhering to the W3C PROV standard. It enables researchers to generate Linked Open Data (LOD) describing the lineage of their scientific assets.

tools.name: Provena
tools.one_line_profile: Provenance system for modelling and simulation workflows
tools.detailed_description: Provena is a provenance system specifically designed to support modelling and simulation workflows. It captures and manages the lineage of simulation data, helping to ensure the reproducibility and auditability of computational scientific models.

tools.name: urg_c
tools.one_line_profile: C library for Hokuyo URG scanning laser range finders
tools.detailed_description: A C library for interfacing with Hokuyo URG laser scanners, widely used in robotics for mapping and navigation tasks. It provides low-level device communication and data acquisition capabilities.

tools.name: senaite.astm
tools.one_line_profile: ASTM instrument communication middleware for SENAITE LIMS
tools.detailed_description: A middleware component for SENAITE LIMS that enables communication with laboratory instruments using the ASTM protocol, facilitating automated data transfer from devices to the information system.

tools.name: senaite.core
tools.one_line_profile: Enterprise Open Source Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
tools.detailed_description: The core component of the SENAITE LIMS ecosystem, providing essential laboratory management functionalities including sample tracking, analysis management, and workflow control for scientific laboratories.

tools.name: senaite.health
tools.one_line_profile: Health care laboratory extension for SENAITE LIMS
tools.detailed_description: An extension for SENAITE LIMS specifically designed for health care laboratories, adding clinical logic and workflows for handling medical samples and patient data.

tools.name: senaite.patient
tools.one_line_profile: Patient data management module for SENAITE LIMS
tools.detailed_description: A module for SENAITE LIMS that provides functionality for managing patient information, linking samples to patients, and handling patient-centric laboratory workflows.

tools.name: senaite.storage
tools.one_line_profile: Sample storage management add-on for SENAITE LIMS
tools.detailed_description: An add-on for SENAITE LIMS that manages the physical storage of laboratory samples, including freezer management and storage position tracking.

tools.name: DATAVIEW
tools.one_line_profile: Big data workflow management system for cloud environments
tools.detailed_description: A big data workflow management system designed to execute scientific workflows on cloud infrastructure (Dropbox/EC2), with a focus on security, privacy, and cost optimization.

tools.name: TemplateFlow
tools.one_line_profile: A framework and archive for neuroimaging templates and atlases
tools.detailed_description: TemplateFlow is a DataLad-based archive that provides a standard, programmatic way to access neuroimaging templates and mappings, ensuring reproducibility in spatial normalization workflows.

tools.name: PROV
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the W3C Provenance Data Model (PROV)
tools.detailed_description: A library to create, manipulate, and serialize provenance data according to the W3C PROV standard, essential for tracking data lineage in scientific workflows.

tools.name: galaxy2cwl
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for Galaxy workflows to Common Workflow Language (CWL)
tools.detailed_description: A utility to translate Galaxy workflow descriptions and executions into abstract CWL interfaces, facilitating workflow interoperability and provenance.

tools.name: Coxgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-robot collaborative, globally consistent, online dense reconstruction system
tools.detailed_description: Coxgraph is a system for multi-robot collaborative dense reconstruction. It enables globally consistent online mapping by maintaining a pose graph of sub-maps and optimizing their alignment, suitable for safety, security, and rescue robotics applications.
